dialogue: How do you mean?

-place is in complete disarray; a whole mess of books and paperwork so I guess we'd just like some tall shelves and cabinetry installed? Maybe make him a ladder with little wheels on it, you know, like you'd see in a real library? He's a voracious reader.
Budapest.
I see. Never been.
Don't mind the mess.
I'm thinking... Shelves up to the ceiling, and some good reading lamps. Perhaps some wall fixtures that extend? Father always keeps the curtains drawn.
-to protect the books from the sunlight. We are south-facing here.
Sure.
Depends on the materials.
Well, make it of reasonable quality. Maybe a nice place for him to sit and read, as well? A good chair or bench for him against the window?
Would you like us to replace that?
If there's time, why not? A branch fell on it during that nasty storm last summer; a tropical depression they called it.
Keep it below six or seven hundred dollars, can you? My sister and I are splitting it. I don't want any unexpected add-ons.
Fell off a beam.
Everyone's famished.
Just a moment please!
Excuse me, sorry. A driver brought me here. I don't recall his name-
She doesn't speak English.
Mr. Toth, I'm sorry to have kept you waiting.
Harrison's gone to bed but he wishes you a good night.
Listen, I am terribly sorry for my father's theatrics. It must have caught you off-guard-
That's all right...
He often makes decisions without consulting the rest of us.
I did not take any of it- to heart-
Oh, but you should. You should, you see. My father would like us to hire you.
-but I have no infrastructure here.
That's why he's asked me to oversee and assist you in this endeavor.
I have no idea of the parameters.
Once I have distilled the essence of father's outburst I will try and make some economic sense of it.

Don't talk to him about money. I've spoken to our friends at the Bucks County Mayor's office who are warm to accessing local and state funding opportunities, on behalf of our project, if we are willing to designate a "specific and meaningful" component of the center for Christian congregation.
It's a community center for all people. What do they want? A prayer room?
I am under the impression they are expecting something more specific and meaningful than that for their earmark. This, and pending their approval of the overall proposal, of course.
An auditorium, a gymnasium, a library-
Father described it as more of a reading room for the public...
-a library, and a chapel? It's four builds, not one.

It's ambitious. Thought you'd like that... I've put in a call to our frequent contractor, Leslie Woodrow. We first worked with Leslie as one of our Ship Engineering Officers but he's supervised several important construction projects for us since- including these offices. My father is allocating a sum of 850,000 dollars for this project which to me seems very reasonable, if not exorbitant. If Leslie agrees to come on-board, I'll have him start a budget for us right away.
Zsofia.
Zs-ofia... Are you planning for school?
Big day, Mr. Toth!
Yes.

Leslie mentioned during our meeting last week with Jim that you're putting your fee back into the project. That seems a bit irresponsible given your situation, doesn't it? Will it even last you to the end of your commitment?
I will figure something out.
Have you discussed it with your wife?
She will be supportive.
Suit yourself but I wouldn't do it, and I know Leslie certainly wouldn't do it, so I didn't want you to think you'd be setting any sort of precedent.
I expect nothing from either of you.
How does that work exactly? The company paying themselves to finance?
Do you not think I deserve to be paid for the time and energy I devote to this project?
Might I make a suggestion?
You may.
Your niece has made several of our guests very uncomfortable. Perhaps you should have a talk with her.
About what?

Don't get me wrong. She's very lovely to look at and as much as we all dream of having a bird that keeps her trap shut, it comes off like a rude affectation. I've tried to connect, make conversation. It goes nowhere.
Oh, I see. It must run in the family.
I would like us to be friends...
This is not- friendly, Harry.
I didn't say I'd like to slip my prick into her. Forget it! I've had too much to drink. I need a nap.
We tolerate you.
It's time for us to go.
